Then find \(S_n\) using following identities
\(\sum_1^n(n)=\frac{n(n+1)}{2}\)
\(\sum_1^n(n^2)=\frac{n(n+1)(2n+1)}{6}\)

solution.text:
The \(n^{th}\) term of in the given question is
\(a_n= (n+_{q}_)\times(_{p}_n+1 )\)
\(a_n= _{p}_n^2+_{{p*q+1}}_n+_{q}_\)
now summing this from 1 to n we will get the sum
\(S_n=\sum_1^n a_n= \sum_1^n(_{p}_n^2+_{{p*q+1}}_n+_{q}_)\)
\(S_n=_{p}_\sum_1^n(n^2)+_{{p*q+1}}_\sum_1^n(n)+_{q}_\sum_1^n(1)\) .....(1)
also we know
\(\sum_1^n(1)=n\)
\(\sum_1^n(n)=\frac{n(n+1)}{2}\)
\(\sum_1^n(n^2)=\frac{n(n+1)(2n+1)}{6}\)
substitution this in equation (1), we will get
\(S_n=_{p}_\frac{n(n+1)(2n+1)}{6}+_{{p*q+1}}_\frac{n(n+1)}{2}+_{q}_n\)
Now putting n=_{s}_
\(S_ {_{s}_}=_{p}_\frac{_{{s*(s+1)*(2*s+1)}}_}{6}+_{{p*q+1}}_\frac{_{{s*(s+1)}}_}{2}+_{q}_\times_{s}_\)
\(S_ {_{s}_}=_{{(p*s*(s+1)*(2*s+1))/6}}_+_{{(((p*q)+1)*s*(s+1))/2}}_+_{{q*s}}_\)
\(S_ {_{s}_}=_{{((p*s*(s+1)*(2*s+1))/6)+((((p*q)+1)*s*(s+1))/2)+(q*s)}}_\)
